virgin adjective
(AREA/THING)
C2 A virgin forest or area of land has not yet been cultivated (= used to grow crops) or used by people: The railway is being extended into areas of virgin forest.
Virgin oil, especially olive oil, is made directly from pressing the fruit, rather than by using heat: extra virgin olive oil
[ before noun ] literary pure and not spoiled, especially when describing something white: a virgin sheet of paper (= one not written on)
